docs.snippet: The U.S. Supreme Court on Tuesday refused to restore a week of early voting in swing-state Ohio, a decision denounced by Democrats but praised by the state's Republican elections chief, who noted voters can still begin casting ballots for the pres...
docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. Supreme Court on Tuesday refused to restore a week of early voting in swing-state Ohio, a decision denounced by Democrats but praised by the state's Republican elections chief, who noted voters can still begin casting ballots for the presidential election in less than a month.

headline.main: US Supreme Court Declines to Restore Early Voting in Ohio
headline.print_headline: US Supreme Court Declines to Restore Early Voting in Ohio

docs.snippet: German Foreign Minister Frank-Walter Steinmeier said on Tuesday he doubted the European Union would agree on a trade deal with the United States called the Transatlantic Trade and Investment Partnership (TTIP) while President Barack Obama was in o...
docs.lead_paragraph: German Foreign Minister Frank-Walter Steinmeier said on Tuesday he doubted the European Union would agree on a trade deal with the United States called the Transatlantic Trade and Investment Partnership (TTIP) while President Barack Obama was in office.

headline.main: German Foreign Minister Doubts EU-US Trade Deal Will Be Agreed This Year

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration’s policy has failed to halt Pyongyang’s nuclear program. But the next White House still has a chance.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Joel S Wit of US-Korea Institute at Johns Hopkins University calls for end to misconceptions that inform United States' failed North Korea policy; argues United States, not China, must take lead and proposes number of measures next president can take towards bringing North to negotiating table regarding its nuclear ambitions.

headline.main: How the Next President Can Stop North Korea

docs.snippet: The United States will provide Israel's military with $38 billion during the next 10 years, officials said Tuesday, the largest batch of military assistance the U.S. has ever pledged to another country....
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States will provide Israel's military with $38 billion during the next 10 years, officials said Tuesday, the largest batch of military assistance the U.S. has ever pledged to another country.

docs.snippet: Why misinformation spreads so quickly in this conspiracy-theory election....
docs.lead_paragraph: Why misinformation spreads so quickly in this conspiracy-theory election.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Zeynep Tufekci underscores how new technologies such as social media aid in dissemination and proliferation of conspiracy theories, like those surrounding Hillary Clinton's health; suggests more government transparency and change in economic models for sources of information could help curb spread of irrational misinformation.

headline.main: Did You Hear the Latest About Hillary?
headline.print_headline: You Hear the Latest on Hillary?

docs.snippet: Russia is preparing to hold a parliamentary election next week. The last time Russia held one was in 2011, when fraud allegations set off a wave of protests in Moscow, among the largest in Russia's post-Soviet history....
docs.lead_paragraph: Russia is preparing to hold a parliamentary election next week. The last time Russia held one was in 2011, when fraud allegations set off a wave of protests in Moscow, among the largest in Russia's post-Soviet history.

headline.main: Russia Opposition Recalls Protests Before Parliamentary Vote
